PostDescription: Today we honor the work of Dr. Martin Luther King Jr.! #MLKDay

Amazon Prime is the gold standard of e-commerce success. Prime's personalized customer experience and overall convenience helped set the bar for online retail. We are interested to see how other brands have learned from their example and stayed competitive through their subscription plans. For example, Walmart+ offers free two-day and next-day shipping while Target RedCard users get free shipping and discounts on their online orders. What features do you look for when signing up for a store's subscription service?
#ecommerce #amazonprime #freeshipping #discount #ecommerce #subscriptionservice #walmart #target #onlineretail

Happy Lohri/ Magh Bihu/ Makar Sankranti/ Pongal/Uttrayan to everyone celebrating!
#lohri #maghbihu #makarsankranti #pongal #uttrayan

Working parents don't have it easy, especially as the pandemic continues. They are essentially working two jobs, something their employers do not always consider when they assign unforgiving schedules.

It is unfair to expect someone's best effort when their job has rigid hours, and their home life pulls them in all different directions. At Fleet Studio, we understand that parenthood is not a nine-to-five job. It's 24/7. Since we have always been a remote-first company, we let our employees manage their own schedules. Giving our team members the freedom to decide their working hours means they can sustain a healthy work-life balance. How else can we make life easier for working parents? #workfromhome #workingparents #workflexibility #remotework #management #pandemic #newnormal
https://bit.ly/3fm0M7F

Since Fleet Studio operates remotely, we've taken the time to hone in on how we run our Zoom calls. When you've been working from home long as we have (over 13 years), you tend to move away from the phrases mentioned in this article by Harvard Business Review. These phrases frame meetings as unpleasant, which is a disservice to you and can be dismissive to your fellow employees. For folks still finding their remote work sealegs, we have some suggestions to keep you from falling back on cliched expressions. When choosing your words, we recommend you cut to the chase, don't use terms that make meetings seem like a bad thing, and give everyone who wishes to speak the space to do so, even if it means scheduling a separate discussion later on. Choosing the right words for the occasion has helped us run productive, focused meetings.

What are some new phrases we can use to phase out the ones in this article? #virtualmeeting #zoom #companyculture #employees #leadership #workingfromhome #remotework 
https://bit.ly/3GmTHQd

At Fleet Studio, we're always interested in scalable integrations that enhance the customer checkout experience without the need for tracking. We think another benefit is that that they allow smaller businesses to gain capital through their e-commerce sites without the risk of being lost in the shuffle of an oversaturated aggregator market. In an era where online retail is more popular than ever, companies like Rokt and Bolt can give e-commerce profits a much-appreciated boost. What e-commerce integrations do you rely on or find useful?
#aggregatormarket #ecommerce #rokt #ecommerce #onlineretail #smallbusiness #bolt #scalability

When entrepreneurs develop a strategy for their direct-to-consumer brands, it's tempting to think about what they can do to get their businesses into the so-called unicorn club. It never hurts to think about this end goal as long as they're willing to play the long game to get there. One of the five tactics The Economic Times suggested was an online-first approach (https://bit.ly/3r3O9U9).

Fleet Studio's work on e-commerce sites and tools, plus other examples of victories for brands like Glossier and Mamaearth, demonstrate the success of this approach. Plenty of successful non-unicorns begin with e-commerce and eventually move to brick and mortar after building a solid foundation.

Besides helping growth before setting up a physical location, what are some other benefits to an online-first approach?
#brickandmortar #ecommerce #unicornclub #onlineretail #branding #glossier #mamaearth

#hiring #developer #analyst #QA #devops #java #remoteopportunities #nodejs

The team at Nordstrom spared no expense to create an AI tool for their e-commerce site that provides suggestions on how to wear the article of clothing their customers view. Friendly artificial intelligence that suggests additional items to help you style a "shacket" is ingenious, and the tool has done wonders for Nordstrom's e-commerce sales and sent them leagues ahead of the competition. 

We appreciate the innovation of using technologies like machine learning to give e-commerce sites an additional edge. What are some other examples of AI successes for online retailers?
#AI #ecommerce #retail #machinelearning #fashion #competitivemarket
https://bit.ly/3zuUoEo

The Economist writers advise managers to look to the Beatles documentary "Get Back" for guidance from one of the greatest creative teams in history. Some of the key takeaways include:

- A diverse team is a strong team: When employees with different work styles and backgrounds come together, they balance each other out. It's a good thing to have a laid-back Ringo to mellow out the opinionated Pauls and Johns of the group.

- Deadlines don't hurt: By setting an attainable goal with a completion deadline, you can help your team focus in.

- Passion for what you do is the best productivity hack: When all of your team members love their work, it's easier for them to "Come Together" to get the job done.

It's a great idea to look outside of our areas of expertise for fresh perspectives on leadership and teamwork. What management tips have you discovered from an outside-of-the-box source?
https://econ.st/3329a9p
#management #teamwork #deadline #diversity #leadership #thebeatles #popculture #freshperspective

Author: Fleet Studio
Description: Stories by Fleet Studio on Medium
PostDescription:
Good artists copy. Great artists steal. Greatest artists copy, thenÂ paste.

If you are the greatest or one of those tried all day to pre-order The Key from stack overflow or youâve ever felt bad about copying code from our site instead of writing it from scratch, forgive yourself! Why recreate the wheel when someone else has done the hard work? The new cloud calls this knowledge reuseâââyouâre reusing what others have already learned, created, and proven. Knowledge reuse isnât a bad thingâââit helps you learn, get working code faster, and reduces your frustration.

You can stand on the shoulders of giants and use their prior lessons learned to build new things of value. You should still follow some basic best practices to prevent bugs or safety issues from sneaking into your code when copying, so make sure you educate yourself before grabbing and pasting. And of course, be aware that some code requires a certain license toÂ use.

To know more in detail on this, hear the official stackoverflow podcast on theÂ same.

https://medium.com/media/7e57d4160c545d7dcf1ec84b162c44ad/href

Shriram Thirukkumaran - Medium
PostTitle: Do you copy + paste your codes from stack overflow? Donât worry you are not alone!
